entry.def: A lay-by is a short strip of road by the side of a main road, where cars can stop for a while.

example.ex: I left my car in a lay-by and set off on foot.
example.tran: 我把车留在路侧停车带，徒步而行。

means.word_mean: 1. designated paved area beside a main road where cars can stop temporarily;

sentences.sentence: "in England they call a rest area a lay-by"

auth_sentence.content: Park in layby just south of Setchey Bridge.
auth_sentence.res_content: Park in layby just south of Setchey Bridge.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Park in layby just south of Setchey Bridge.

auth_sentence.content: Mr Mead can then be seen lying ten yards away in the layby with his crushed bike.
auth_sentence.res_content: Mr Mead can then be seen lying ten yards away in the layby with his crushed bike.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Mr Mead can then be seen lying ten yards away in the layby with his crushed bike.
